result: Queestion 32) Sociology has not yet surpassed the age of constructions and philosophical synthesis. Instead of assuming the task of shedding light on a restricted portion of the social field, it prefers to seek brilliant generalities in which all issues are raised without any being expressly dealt with. Above all, generalizations are sometimes wide and so hastily are not susceptible to any type of proof. DURKHEIM, E. Suicide: Study of Sociology. SÃ£o Paulo: Martin's Fontes, 2000.
